greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of Product_{k>=1} 1/(1+x^k)^(k^2) in powers of x.
comment: This sequence is obtained from the generalized Euler transform in A266964 by taking f(n) = n^2, g(n) = -1. - _Seiichi Manyama_, Nov 15 2017
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: a(0) = 1, a(n) = -(1/n)*Sum_{k=1..n} A078307(k)*a(n-k) for n > 0. - _Seiichi Manyama_, Apr 06 2017
G.f.: exp(Sum_{k>=1} (-1)^k*x^k*(1 + x^k)/(k*(1 - x^k)^3)). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, May 30 2018
program: (PARI) x= 'x + O('x^40); Vec(prod(k=1, 40, 1/(1 + x^k)^(k^2))) \\ _Indranil Ghosh_, Apr 05 2017
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Apr 05 2017
